alert.note: Alert for Niihau in Kauai (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 20 at 7:20PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM HST THIS EVENING FOR THE ISLAND OF KAUAI IN KAUAI COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The island of Kauai in Kauai County. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 712 PM HST, radar showed bands of moderate to heavy rainfall moving over Kauai from the southeast with rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour. Water levels have begun to rise in the streams across much of the island, which could lead to runoff impacting vulnerable low lying areas and roads through the late evening hours. - This includes the entire island of Kauai. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 1030 PM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding. A Flood Watch is also in effect.
